author: Corky Emrick
title: Centreville sweeps White Pigeon
text: By Corky Emrick Posted Oct. 7, 2015 at 10:42 PM Everything was just beachy for the Centreville volleyball team as they swept White Pigeon 25-15, 25-18, 25-10 at beach night Wednesday. “It was a great night of volleyball. We are working on the little things and pushing ourselves each and every game,” coach Melissa Gales said. “These girls are feeling and playing well.” Hannah Marchand led the Lady Bulldogs with 12 kills and added 10 digs and two blocks. Bailee May had 13 digs, six aces, six kills and two blocks, Madison Hunter had 14 assists, eight kills, nine digs and two blocks. Skyler DeMeyer had 14 assists, 16 digs, three kills and two aces, Kalee Schrock had two aces, two assists, two digs and one kill, Sara Lewis added two digs and one ace and Carlee Odom had two blocks, two digs, one kill, one assist and one ace. Leading the Lady Chiefs was Riley Phelps with 11 kills, eight digs and one ace, while Kathrina Hagner added four kills, one dig and one block and Sydney Harmon had two kills, three digs and one block. Madi Gremore had two kills and four digs, Cheyenne Yoder added 14 assists and five digs, Paige Brock had one assist, one kills and one dig and Grace Keyer had three digs. Mendon 25, 25, 25 New Buffalo 8, 10, 16 Mendon took three quick games 25-8, 25-10, 25-16 from New Buffalo Tuesday night. “We played well and we took care of business,” coach Bill Trenary said. Kaley Smith had 21 digs and five aces, Amaijha Bailey added four aces, Emma Eberstein had 10 digs and six kills, Megann Leighton led with 19 kills and one block and Cassie Plummer had a team high 27 assists.
